form.official-title: To amend the Safe Drinking Water Act to provide assistance to schools to replace drinking water fountains that may contain lead, and for other purposes.

section.header: Drinking water fountain replacement for schools

subsection.text: Part F of the Safe Drinking Water Act (42 U.S.C. 300j–21 et seq.) is amended by adding at the end the following:

section.header: Drinking water fountain replacement for schools

subsection.text: Not later than 180 days after the date of enactment of this section, the Administrator shall establish a grant program to provide assistance to local educational agencies for the replacement of drinking water fountains manufactured prior to 1988.
Funds awarded under the grant program—

paragraph.text: shall be used to pay the costs of replacement of drinking water fountains in schools; and

may be used to pay the costs of monitoring and reporting of lead levels in the drinking water of schools of a local educational agency receiving such funds, as determined appropriate by the Administrator.

subsection.text: There are authorized to be appropriated to carry out this section not more than $5,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2019 through 2023.
Section 1461 of the Safe Drinking Water Act (42 U.S.C. 300j–21) is amended—

subparagraph.text: by inserting or drinking water fountain after drinking water cooler each place it appears; and
by inserting or fountain after the cooler; and

paragraph.text: in paragraph (5), by inserting or drinking water fountain after water cooler each place it appears.
